Sosialisasi 4 Pilar, MPR Gelar Cerdas Cermat Antar SMA Se-Indonesia
02 Nov 2019, 15:56 by Angga Laraspati
Jakarta - MPR RI menggelar lomba cerdas cermat untuk mensosialisasikan Empat Pilar MPR. Lomba yang bertempat di Kompleks Parlemen itu mempertemukan SMAN 2 Kerinci Jambi, SMAN 3 Polewali Sulawesi Barat, dan SMAN 1 Brebes Jawa Tengah dalam final.
Dalam lomba cerdas cermat ini para peserta harus melalui dua segmen, yakni segmen kreativitas dan segmen perlombaan. Kreativitas di mana masing-masing sekolah menampilkan yel-yel tim yang harus mengacu pada 4 Pilar. Sedangkan dalam Perlombaan, para peserta harus melalui babak kasus, benar-salah, dan satu lawan satu.
Anggota MPR dari Fraksi PAN Alimin Abdullah, ditunjuk sebagai Ketua Dewan Juri. Perlombaan berlangsung seru, karena ketiga tim pada awalnya mengoleksi poin yang sama yaitu 75 poin. Namun, di penghujung final SMAN 1 Brebes berhasil keluar sebagai juara setelah mampu mengoleksi poin tertinggi.
Raihan suara itu membuat Kontingen SMAN 1 Brebes kegirangan. Menurut pendamping sekolah, Maryati, kemenangan diraih karena kontingennya melakukan belajar dan berdoa. Maryati mengatakan SMAN 1 Brebes melalui proses dari lomba di tingkat provinsi sehingga pembinaan di Semarang.
"Kami melakukan sejak Juni," tutur Maryati dalam keterangan tertulis, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
Pembinaan yang dilakukan oleh sekolah yang berada di Pantura itu tak hanya dilakukan oleh guru namun juga dari Universitas Negeri Semarang. Lewat Dr. Suprayogi, dosen PKN Universitas Negeri Semarang, sekolah itu menjadi lebih matang.
Suprayogi mengatakan ia menambal kekurangan-kekurangan materi yang diberikan. "Kekurangan materi kami lengkapi", tuturnya.
Kegembiraan dari SMAN 1 Brebes bertambah karena mereka juga memenangi lomba kreativitas. Mereka meraih suara 87. Sedangkan SMAN 2 Kerinci mendapat 83 dan SMAN 3 Polewali meraih 85. Yel yel mereka memadukan berbagai musik dan dengung suara.
Alimin Abdullah pun merasa kagum dengan kekritisan peserta. Untuk itu dirinya memberi apresiasi kepada semua peserta. Sebagai anggota yang biasa melakukan sosialisasi, Alimin dalam kesempatan final dipercaya sebagai dewan juri secara berturut turut.

4 Pillars Socialization, MPR Holds Careful Intelligent Between High Schools in Indonesia
02 Nov 2019, 15:56 by Angga Laraspati
Jakarta - MPR RI held a quiz contest to socialize the Four Pillars of the MPR. The competition, which took place at the Parliament Complex, brought together SMAN 2 Kerinci Jambi, SMAN 3 Polewali West Sulawesi, and SMAN 1 Brebes, Central Java in the final.
In this quiz contest, participants must go through two segments, namely the creativity segment and the competition segment. Creativity in which each school displays team chants that must refer to the 4 Pillars. Whereas in the Race, participants must go through a round of cases, true-false, and one on one.
MPR member from the PAN Faction Alimin Abdullah, was appointed as Chairman of the Jury. The race took place exciting, because all three teams initially collected the same points which is 75 points. However, at the end of the SMAN 1 final Brebes managed to come out as champions after being able to collect the highest points.
The sound of the noise made the Contingent of SMAN 1 Brebes excited. According to the school's assistant, Maryati, the victory was achieved because her contingent did study and pray. Maryati said SMAN 1 Brebes through the process of the competition at the provincial level so that training in Semarang.
"We have been doing it since June," Maryati said in a written statement, Saturday (11/02/2019).
The training carried out by the school in Pantura is not only done by teachers but also from Semarang State University. Through Dr. Suprayogi, lecturer at PKN Semarang State University, the school has become more mature.
Suprayogi said he patched the deficiencies in the material provided. "We complete the material shortages", he said.
The excitement from SMAN 1 Brebes increased because they also won the creativity contest. They won 87 votes. While SMAN 2 Kerinci got 83 and SMAN 3 Polewali won 85. Their slogans combined a variety of music and buzzing sounds.
Alimin Abdullah was impressed with the participants' criticism. For that he gave appreciation to all participants. As a member who used to conduct outreach, Alimin was on the final occasion entrusted with successive judges.
